quote: Captain's log, stardate 41463.9.   We are mapping the Pleiades   Cluster which has many young   planets and we've been asked by   the Federation to visit a group   terraforming Velara III, which   we would very much like to see.   Communications have been erratic   and there is some concern about   their welfare.
scene: 1    EXT. SPACE - THE ENTERPRISE - VELARA III IN B.G.

quote: Entering standard orbit -- now.
It takes special people to live   in such desolation.
Visionaries, who don't see this   planet as it is, but as it will   be.
I've always wanted to see   terraforming in operation.
Hailing frequency, Lieutenant Yar.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
Velara III base, this is Captain   Picard of the starship Enterprise.
Lieutenant Yar... ?
No equipment malfunction on either   end, sir. They are receiving.
Velara III, this is the Enterprise.   Come in please.
Maybe nobody's home.
We are sensing life-forms, sir.
Velara III, do you copy?
Velara Base to Enterprise. Uh...   yes, Captain. Director Mandl   here. Sorry for the delay. We   weren't expecting visitors.
Terraform Command has asked us   to see how you were getting along.
... We were a little behind, but   we're back on schedule.
We alarm him for some reason.
Your staff is all well, I presume,   Director?
Understandably tired. We're all   working very hard, Captain.
Is there anything we can do to   help?... You and your staff are   welcome aboard for a change of   scene and some rest. We have some   Holodecks you might enjoy.
No disrespect, sir, we can't   afford to take the time.
His fear is escalating.
If you'll excuse me, I must get   back to work.
I sense deliberate concealment,   sir.
Of what?
I don't know, but it's intense.
We've heard so much about your   remarkable achievements in   terraforming, that my staff would   very much appreciate looking   around.
... It's not really the best time.   We are at a critical phase just   now.
We do not require any special   attention.
I'm trying not to be rude, sir,   but it would be inconvenient just   now.
He's concealing something and it's   more than just being too busy.   Your announcement about coming   down has pushed him almost to the   point of panic.
Whether he wants us or not...       Director Mandl, unless you are   absolutely refusing permission   for us to land on your station,   please prepare to receive my   away team.
As you wish.
Stay on your toes, Number One.   Counselor, perhaps you should go   along. A man this tense is   unpredictable.
Welcome to Velara III. Remember   it as it is now, because in a   couple of decades you won't recognize   the place.       Luisa Kim. Gardener of Edens.
Commander William Riker, USS   Enterprise. This is Lieutenant   Commander Data, Counselor Troi,   Lieutenant Yar and Lieutenant   La Forge.
This is Bjorn Bensen, Chief   Engineer, and Arthur Malencon,   our Hydraulics Specialist,
An android.
And third in command of the   Enterprise.
Where were you manufactured --   are there others like you?
Both matters are subjects of   protracted discussion.
Remarkable.
We don't get visitors. It's   exciting to have you here.
We weren't sure how we would be   received. Director Mandl seemed   less than enthusiastic about our   interest.
I should apologize for him. We   are at a critical phase. Usually   he's quite charming.
We'll stay out of your way, it's   just that we've never seen a   terraforming station, and couldn't   resist the opportunity.
How much do you know about the   process?
The theories -- the reports -- but   nothing firsthand.
Oh, wonderful. Then let me show   you around.
The other two are as veiled and   secretive as Mandl, but she is   not.

What we're doing is so exciting,   so -- inspiring. We take a   lifeless planet and little by   little transform it into an   M-class environment, capable of   supporting life. Terraforming   makes you feel a little godlike.       Is that a terribly arrogant thing   to say?
Not at all. It is accurate.

The first phase is selecting the   planet. That's very important.   It must have the right mass and   gravity, the correct rate of   rotation, and a balanced day and   night. The planet must also be   without life or having the   prospect of life delveloping   naturally. The Federation makes   that decision. Then...    (she pauses a beat for     emphasis)   ... we take over.

What you see here -- this station   -- is Phase Two. Phase Three   involves the water. Usually we   create basins, using hydraulic   landscaping, but the water on   this planet is subsurface, and   extremely high in salt content.   We are just about to begin pumping   and filtering that water,   removing the salt, oxygenating   and replacing. Next we introduce   micro-organisms, and when the   process is complete...
... eventually, we'll have a   lush, arable, biosphere.
You make it sound poetic.
I think it's the best occupation   in the universe.
The efficiency of your hydraulic   landscaping is elegant.
It isn't yet -- but it will be.   Right now, I'm disturbed by   erratic power surges in several   of the servomechanisms that   control the hydraulic probes.
Could it be the increased   conductivity caused by the high   saline content?
(with the enthusiasm     of one scientist to     another)   That was my first thought, but..
Arthur.
We checked that out. That wasn't   it.
I'm Director Mandl. I am sorry   about being so abrupt during our   initial contact, being isolated   one tends to forget the social   graces. Are you seeing everything   you want?
What you are doing here is   miraculous.

What we are doing here is working   on a difficult, demanding   timetable, and there will be no   miracle unless Malencon gets the   hydraulic probes back on line.   We are set to step up to full   conversion, immediately.       Shouldn't you be in the hydraulics   chamber, Arthur?
Now?
Yes.
All right, Kurt.
That must be the master subsurface   pump. Impressive.
(indicating another area     on the computer screen)   This is interesting. How the   water table is a thin ribbon   between the sandy surface layer   and the rock below.
And it follows the contour precisely.
Which would require extreme   precision from the probe controls.
Here's something which should   interest you. The vegetation   graphs are really the key element   to successful terraforming.
Incredible. It's planned month   by month, decade by decade.
Every single thing we do is   specific and exacting. You see   grand, romantic concepts. I see   unyielding rock under an ocean   of sand.
Commander... !
What is it, Deanna?
Malencon. He's in trouble.
Can you open it?
It's jammed.
Let me try.
We're too late.

Captain's log, supplemental. What   began as a routine visit to the   Federation group terraforming   Velara III has become a serious   situation. Arthur Malencon, the   hydraulics engineer, has been   killed in an extraordinary   accident.
Situation report, Number One.

(tense, trying to save     a life)   For safety reasons, we're shutting   off all power to the hydraulics   room before entering to recover   the body. Then we'll beam him   up to Sickbay, but from the look   of his wounds, it's probably   hopeless.
Keep me informed.
Data... ?
Go ahead, Geordi.
All set.
We have your section powered down   now. Bensen has locked the master   servomotor drive system. It   should be safe in there now.
I'm going in.
I will go with you.
Transporter Room, this is   Lieutenant Yar. Two to beam up   to Sickbay.
I want to go. We should be with   him.       Kurt, please come too.
Transporter Room, this is   Commander Riker. Beam up four   at my coordinates.
I have seen malfunctions, but   this is unprecedented. Almost   as if the laser drill attempted   to tear itself apart.
I can't explain it.
The laser blasts seemed to end   when the yelling stopped.
Maybe Arthur stopped it -- only   not in time.
Not possible.
Then what are you suggesting?
Uncertain.       Geordi, would you please return   power to the control console in   this room. I want to reactivate   the program.
I am running the base drilling   program.
Servos OFF!
They are off!
Data, what's happening?
Too much to explain.
La Forge to Enterprise. We have   a problem!
Open the door!
STAY OUT! It is under control.
Data --
Are you injured?
No.
A year's work destroyed!
I had no choice.
Away team report now! What is   happening?
... We were attempting to trace   the source of the malfunction when   it attacked me.
How much more of this fantasy must   I listen to?
None at all, Mr. Mandl. Until   this is sorted out, I've provided   temporary quarters for you and   your crew. I suggest you use   them.
You're overstepping your   authority, Picard! You have no   right to interfere.
An attack on one of my crew gives   me the right, Mr. Mandl.
I have a schedule to meet!
Your schedule is on hold, until   I have a satisfactory explanation   of what happened.
Director Mandl. Wait.       Escort the director to his   quarters.
Aye, sir.
Proceed with your report.

It would appear that the laser   drilling systems had been   reprogrammed.       As soon as its memory bank   received power, it turned itself   on and went after me.   Fortunately, I was able to cope   with it.
Not by much, from what I saw.
I believe it was programmed to   destroy any person moving in that   room.
Speculation or certainty?
Certainty.
It would have required the talents   of a master programmer.
But it was done.

Then the question is not who,   because obviously it was one of   the three remaining terraformers.   The question is why. What are   they hiding? What is so important   it could make one of them, or all   of them desperate enough to take   a life?
Shall I have them brought in, sir?
Not yet.
Doctor Crusher?
Malencon never had a chance.   The injuries were too severe, the   damage too extensive.
The entire Velara III facility   has been powered down, Captain.
We've just completed a remote   power feed to the life support   systems.
Good. Data, I want you and Geordi   to return for a more careful   inspection.
What are we to look for, sir?
Evidence of tampering, negligence,   sabotage... whatever. I don't   know, but the answer's there, on   the planet.

Tasha, I'd like you to provide   Counselor Troi and me with   complete personnel files on our   three guests. Psych profiles,   training, everything. I'm looking   for motive, intent... the   psychological capacity to commit   one murder and attempt another.
Aye, sir.
It seems we've become policemen,   Number One.
Geordi. I need some visual   assistance.
What is it?
Inorganic. Nothing but basic   elements. No carbon... sandy   texture... But the flashes are   almost... musical. I see color   variations and rhythms which are   like a melody.
Speculation. Could it be alive?
How could it be alive? It's   inorganic.
Whatever this is, it could be   what they are covering up -- and   the reason someone killed   Malencon.
Captain's log, supplemental. On   my order, Data's startling   discovery of a possible indigenous   and inorganic life-form --   something hitherto thought   impossible...
... has been beamed aboard so that   its true nature might be   uncovered.
Activate.
Let's be sure of what we have   here.       Is the sample organic?
Negative carbon. Negative known   life components. Substance   inorganic.
Recheck analysis.
Rechecking... Analysis verified.   Not organic.
Magnify to screen.
Magnify -- factor rate five.       Hold surface. Rate ten.       Hold.
What are we looking at?
It's really beautiful. Whatever   it is...
What's causing that hum?
Computer, what is the magnification?
Twenty five thousand diameters   and holding.
Analysis. The pattern of the   flashes.
Not random or repetitive or   sequential. Pattern not   recognized.
What is the source of the flashes?
Unable to specify. Theoretically   not possible from this substance.
Disregard incongruity and theorize   as to source?
Life.
What do you mean a life-form?!   What life-form?! A Federation   recon expedition certified Velara   III lifeless.
Understandable, given this   particular life-form's novel   nature.
And just what is that nature?
Doctor Crusher is still making   her determination.       I presume you know the Prime   Directive, Mr. Mandl.
Are you saying I knowingly defied   it?
I don't know. But I intend to   find out.       You're a man obsessed with what   he does. Who knows what an   obsessed man would do to keep   going? Kill, perhaps?
I create life! I don't take it!
What do you think?
You hit him pretty hard, Captain.
Counselor?
It was useful.       I felt two levels. He knew about   the life-form. The idea of murder   seemed to shock him. I couldn't   tell if it was the whole idea,   or just being accused of it.
What about his file, Lieutenant   Yar? Could he have accomplished   the reprogramming that Data says   took place?
Mandl holds advanced degrees in   Computer Science as well as   Artificial Intelligence. It's   possible.
What about the others? Including   the victim.

Only the victim had the required   expertise. But Malencon did work   where the... whatever-it-is...   was found. Trying to suppress   that knowledge would be motive   for murder... if Mandl were   obsessed enough.
Terraformers are often obsessive.   It goes with the career profile.
How do you read the designer?
Possessed of a highly abstracted   reality. Lovely visions, little   data.       You might do better than I.
Luisa... are you all right?
It isn't locked.
Mind a visitor?
Is it true... did you really find   a life-form?
It's still being debated in some   quarters. But I think so, yes.
What's it like?
We have nothing to compare it to,   but it's microscopic... seems   colonial... simple... and   inorganic.       That's why the recon scouts missed   it. This one wasn't your mistake.
Everything I've worked for is   falling apart.
It's very beautiful. I'll arrange   for you to see it, if you like.
Perhaps later.
Captain, this is Doctor Crusher.   I think you'd better come to the   Medical Lab.
What is it?
Geordi observed movement.
It's not exactly movement, it's   a shift in the energy pattern.
Without external influence.
Couldn't coordinated static   charges promote the shift?
Yes, if any were present in the   jar, but none is.
It's changing.
I can't see any difference.
The infrared range is increasing.
Warning. Input overload. Input   overload.
It is projecting an energy field!
And it's increasing!
Only life can replicate itself,   Doctor. Inorganic or not, it is   alive.
Activate quarantine field.
Quarantine field full!
(continuing; more     imperative)   Full shield backup!
Translation request being patched.
Translation? From whom?
Evacuating lab.
Full shield backup in place but   weakening... translation grhjkj   wljkdh...
What's going on with the   translator circuit?
bridge, this is the captain.   Request emergency power to   increase lab quarantine seal...
Do it, Mister Worf.       What's the nature of the problem,   Captain? We've lost visual.
We have confirmed Data's discovery   is life, but more than that - it   is intelligent.
How do you know?
It has just taken possession of   the Medical Lab.
Because it's trying to communicate   with us!

Captain's log, supplemental. We   are attempting to deal with the   aggressive inorganic life-form   which Data brought up from the   planet. It has taken over the   Medical Lab, and is apparently   attempting to communicate with   us.
It generates enough energy to   interfere with surrounding   systems.
Mr. La Forge -- can we see into   the lab yet?
Negative, Captain. But, reducing   backup to the quarantine seal   might help.
Doctor?
I wouldn't.
Continue backup to shield,   Lieutenant.
Director Mandl and the others are   in the Observation Lounge as you   requested.
Counselor, I'll need you.       You have the bridge, Number One.
What do you know of this   life-form?
Nothing.
You knew of its existence.
Yes.
Is this true?       You knew there was life on Velara   III?
I knew there were random energy   patterns -- I knew that. But   that's not life. Not by any   definition I have ever heard.
But, you tried to hide that   knowledge from us.
They're meaningless silicon   crystals, which rebroadcast sunlight.   This is absurd.
They are not only alive but they   have intelligence.
Why do you say that?
They're trying to communicate   with us.
Communicate with you?
I need information, now. When   did you first see them? What   were they doing? Why did you   think they were alive?
... There were patterns, in the   sand, appearing and disappearing --
Captain, we've regained a visual   on the lab.
Patch visual to Observation   Lounge...
I cannot understand the patterns.
Neither can I.
Please show me the spectral analysis.   Magnification twelve K.
But is it alive?!
Probability positive...
I wasn't asking you.
Engineering to bridge.
This is Commander Riker, go ahead.
The backup on the lab seal is   fluctuating, sir. I think you   should come down here.
On my way.       Data, you have the bridge. Inform   the captain.
Status, Ensign?

The quarantine seal is getting   weaker. Every time I try to   redirect backup... it goes   somewhere else.       I think I've... it's... locked   three people in a turbolift and   two more in the programmers' rest   room.
If that's reading right, there is   no seal.       Give me a lab interior image.
Magnify.
Captain, this is Riker.
We see it too, Number One.
Get that seal back up!
No matter what I do, the energy   goes somewhere else. What if it   hits the Nursery... Or Sickbay... ?
Hold off.       Impossible, Captain. We haven't   got the power.
The Universal Translator is   coming on line.
Ugly... Ugly... Giants... Bags   of Mostly Water...
Bags of mostly water?
An accurate description, sir, of   humans. You are, after all, over   ninety per cent water, surrounded   by a flexible container.
Do you understand me?
We understand. We ask you be gone...   We call... We talk... You not listen.
We didn't hear you. We come in   peace.
Ugly Bag of Mostly Water... we try   at peace... you still not listen.       Bag in Dome on Sand of Home...   we killed.
It killed Malencon.
We see and hear you now. We   didn't know you were there. You   are beautiful to us. All life is   beautiful.
Bag in dome did know. Made some   of us die. Made us kill. War is   now with you.
Can you hear me?
Duty stations! Report!
Restabilizing, sir.
Sir...
What is it, Data?
That chaos in the lab, when we   were studying it... must have   been the energy surge of a   reproductive cycle.       It is now a colony of single cells   which organize as a computer.
More is stronger.
Captain's log, supplemental.   We've stumbled on a life-form...
... biologically and   psychologically difficult for   us to fully understand.       The only thing totally clear is   that this microbrain, as we've   come to call it, has declared war   on us.
Their range of influence appears   to be concentrated in the Medical   Lab, Captain.
All non-essential personnel have   been moved to the most distant   areas of the ship, sir.
Data -- any analysis of those   bolts of light they emit?

That seems to be their method of   reprogramming, Captain. Each bolt   of light consists of negatively   and positively charged ions. A   series of program instructions,   as it were.       They seem to have a quicker   rapport with our computers than   we do.
What do you expect? They are   computers.
Have we disabled the Medical Lab   computer console?
Aye, sir, as soon as Data   determined the microbrain's method   of operation.
I am picking up a decrease in the   infra-red intensity.
Maybe the life-form has reached   its own energy limit.
Or maybe this is not the end of   it.       With single-celled life-forms...   at least organic ones, cell   division can be preceded by a   resting state.
The calm before the storm.
Let's use the calm. Medical Lab   on main viewer.
It does seem dormant.
Lieutenant Yar - set coordinates   to beam it back where it came   from.
Coordinates set.
Energize!
Transporter power has been   redirected, sir. We are unable   to affect it.

Life-form or not... intelligent   or not -- the safety of this ship   and all on her are my primary   responsibility.       Data -- evacuate the air from the   Medical Lab. I want a vacuum in   there.
Environmental systems fail to   respond to commands, Captain.   It appears the microbrain has   successfully interfaced with our   computer.
Suggestions?       Anyone?
I need your help. We have   communicated with the life-form   discovered on Velara III.
You have what?!
It has told us that it attempted   to communicate with you, and you   ignored it.
If it was trying to communicate   with us, we didn't understand   that.
We didn't try.
What you were doing was so   threatening to them that they   killed your hydraulics engineer   to stop it. They have declared   a state of war.
A state of war?!

Yes, and we're on the defensive.   I need your help. I have to find   some way to fight them. We no   longer have control of the Medical   Lab, or the computer. At this   moment they have the power to   destroy this ship and everyone   on it.
Unbelievable. What can we do   to help?
They said you killed some of them.   I need to know how.
I -- I don't know.
Exactly what was Malencon doing   when he was killed?
There is a very thin layer of   highly saline water under the   sandy topsoil. He was siphoning   that off.
Why would that kill some of them?
Liquid supports life. Perhaps   somehow, that saline water   sustained them.
It connected them.
I don't understand.
The microbrains are like our brain   cells. Individually a cell has   life -- but not intelligence -- yet   when interconnected their combined   intelligence is formidable.
So that saline fluid is their   circuitry.
And to prevent its loss, they   killed Malencon.
If we had continued to remove the   water... we would have destroyed   them all.
Reason enough for anyone to go   to war.
Captain -- it's happening again!
If this keeps up, that thing will   tear the Enterprise apart!
Captain -- sensors indicate the   microbrain expends a tremendous   amount of energy during its   reproduction cycle. Yet, there   is no discernible power drain from   our own systems.
Then what's feeding the damn   thing!?
Data and I found traces of   cadmium salts. Cadmium is a   conduit for converting infra-red   into electricity.
Meaning?
Meaning the microbrains might be   photoelectric.
Okay, let's see if darkness will   neutralize them. Kill the lights   in the lab, Mr. La Forge. We can   at least do that.
Sorry, Captain, can't do it by   remote.
Number One...
On my way.
The creatures must have evolved   at that narrow layer where the   light got through the sand to the   water... Drop the water a   centimeter below the light   penetration level and they starve.
Kill lab lights -- now!
It's slowing down.
Getting dimmer, too.
We copy fine now... more light   please...
Darkness death terrible. Go home   to warm sand...       War over.
We are happy to agree with you.
Riker to Transporter Chief. Pick   up the coordinates of the bell   jar in the Medical Lab for return   to Velara III.
... Coordinates entered, sir.
Riker to bridge. Captain, we're   ready to beam it back to the   planet.
I wish we were able to learn more   about them.
In time, Mr. Data. When we're   better prepared.
Our apologies.
And our respect.       Lieutenant Yar...
Coordinates set, sir.
Energize!
Captain's log, stardate 41464.2.   Declaring indefinite quarantine   for the Velara System...
... Returning to starbase with   surviving Terraformers.
